intro: Achillea dshimilensis, commonly known as the Dshimil Mountain yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
